attributes.action: uphold the rights of UK citizens to blow the whistle on corruption in public institutions without risk of forfeit in keeping with the Bill of Rights 1689, Public Interest Disclosure Act 1998, and Article 10 Human Rights Act 1998; and without censorship on this website.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This relates to the rejection of a petition on the scandal of Welsh Universities who participate in what has become known as the ‘plagiarism game’, whereby fabricated accusations of plagiarism are made against students who in their opinion should not be there for reasons of social class, or who rock the boat and complain. Moreover, the Student Complaints Scheme is wholly inadequate in dealing with this sort of institutionalised abuse. The Prime Minister should support the Queen who as Visitor to the Federal University has written to the First Minister of the National Assembly for Wales on the subject of proper complaints procedures being in place.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
